You can choose to take a –1 {g|Encyclopedia:Penalty}penalty{/g} on all {g|Encyclopedia:MeleeAttack}melee attack{/g} rolls and {g|Encyclopedia:Combat_Maneuvers}combat maneuver{/g} {g|Encyclopedia:Check}checks{/g} to gain a +2 {g|Encyclopedia:Bonus}bonus{/g} on all melee {g|Encyclopedia:Damage}damage rolls{/g}.
This bonus to damage is increased by half (+50%) if you are making an {g|Encyclopedia:Attack}attack{/g} with a {g|Encyclopedia:Light_Weapon}two-handed{/g} weapon, a one handed weapon using two hands, or a primary {g|Encyclopedia:NaturalAttack}natural weapon{/g} that adds 1-1/2 times your {g|Encyclopedia:Strength}Strength{/g} modifier on damage rolls. This bonus to damage is halved (–50%) if you are making an attack with an off-hand weapon or secondary natural weapon.
When your {g|Encyclopedia:BAB}base attack bonus{/g} reaches +4, and every 4 points thereafter, the penalty increases by –1 and the bonus to damage increases by +2.
The effects of this {g|Encyclopedia:Feat}feat{/g} last until your next turn. The bonus damage does not apply to {g|Encyclopedia:TouchAttack}touch attacks{/g} or effects that do not deal {g|Encyclopedia:HP}hit point{/g} damage.
